modelCorrections.afterModification: <html lang="en" class="v2 js js" dir="ltr" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:b="http://www.google.com/2005/gml/b" xmlns:data="http://www.google.com/2005/gml/data" xmlns:expr="http://www.google.com/2005/gml/expr">
modelCorrections.rawOutput:
- Thought: To address the WCAG 2.1 violation, I need to add the "lang" attribute to the <html> element. Given the extracted text, "Your personal data will be," it implies the content is likely in English. Therefore, I will assign "en" as the value for the "lang" attribute.

- Corrected HTML: <html lang="en" class="v2 js js" dir="ltr" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:b="http://www.google.com/2005/gml/b" xmlns:data="http://www.google.com/2005/gml/data" xmlns:expr="http://www.google.com/2005/gml/expr">
